data.question: What is the chemical formula for the Mesitylcopper-Stabilized Tetrasilicide Tetraanion?
Who was the first tetrahedral tetrasilane prepared by and in what year?
What solvent was used to isolate [Si9]n(2-) clusters?
What is the ratio of [Si4]4(2-) and [Si9]4(2-) clusters in neat solids A12Si17?
What was the outcome of reactions between R3PCuCl and A12Si17 in liquid ammonia?
data.answer: Isolation of Rb4Si9(NH3)5, which contains the fourfold negatively charged polysilicide anion [Si9]4(2-)

data.question: What is the structural difference between the polysilicide anion in Rb4Si9(NH3)5 and Rb4Si9(NH3)4.75?
data.answer: The hexagonal arrangement of 2 a along a screw axis parallel to [001] and its coordination environment

data.question: What was the result of the reaction between K6Rb6Si17, MesCu, and [18]crown-6 in liquid ammonia?
Is the [Si4]4(2-) anion stable according to quantum-chemical calculations?
data.answer: Yes, as indicated by large HOMO–LUMO gaps

data.question: Does the coordination of MesCu fragments affect the Cu–C and C–C bonds?
data.answer: No, the Cu–C and the C–C bonds of the MesCu fragments are not affected by the coordination to the silicon tetrahedron

data.question: Is the Cu–Si bond in [(MesCu)2Si4]4(2-) considered electrostatic?
data.answer: Yes, the Cu–Si bond is considered as an electrostatic interaction

data.question: Can highly charged silicon clusters be obtained and handled in solution?
data.answer: Yes, the formation of [(MesCu)2Si4]4(2-) shows that highly charged silicon clusters can be obtained and handled in solution

data.question: Is the coordination of copper(I) to tetrahedral P4 similar to the coordination of MesCu to the silicon tetrahedron?
data.answer: Yes, the coordination is comparable as both involve bridging between molecules and elongation of coordinated bonds
